alert.note: Alert for Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued February 22 at 8:05PM MST until February 23 at 9:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, snow and blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 MPH. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 degrees below zero. * WHERE...Sierra Madre Range and Snowy Range. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 5 AM MST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 5 PM this afternoon to 9 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning and evening commutes. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
